name: Sigiriya
reason_for_fav:
Sigiriya is famous for its ancient rock fortress, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. 
It is renowned for its stunning frescoes, ancient gardens, and impressive architecture dating back to the 5th century AD.

name: Galle Fort
reason_for_fav:
Galle Fort is a well-preserved colonial-era fortification in Galle, Sri Lanka. 
It is famous for its historical significance, architectural beauty, and scenic views of the Indian Ocean. 
It's also a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Temple of the Tooth
reason_for_fav:
The Temple of the Tooth, located in Kandy, houses the sacred tooth relic of the Buddha. 
It is one of the most important pilgrimage sites for Buddhists worldwide and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Adam's Peak
reason_for_fav:
Adam's Peak, also known as Sri Pada, is a sacred mountain in central Sri Lanka. 
It is famous for the 'Sri Pada' or 'sacred footprint' at its summit, which is revered by Buddhists, Hindus, Muslims, and Christians alike.

name: Yala National Park
reason_for_fav:
Yala National Park is the most visited and second-largest national park in Sri Lanka. 
It is famous for its diverse wildlife, including the highest concentration of leopards in the world, elephants, sloth bears, and a variety of bird species.

name: Nuwara Eliya
reason_for_fav:
Nuwara Eliya is a picturesque hill station known as 'Little England' due to its colonial architecture, cool climate, and tea plantations. 
It is famous for its scenic beauty, hiking trails, and as a popular retreat destination.

name: Kandy
reason_for_fav:
Kandy, located in the central province of Sri Lanka, is famous for its cultural heritage, including the Temple of the Tooth, which houses the sacred tooth relic of the Buddha. 
It is also known for its scenic beauty, vibrant festivals, and tea plantations.
